sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"接受，接纳"之意。
means: accept ：强调主动地或自愿地接受，或者说，经过考虑后同意接受。
receive ：着重仅仅接到或收到这一支轮船或事实，而不含采取主动或积极行动的意思。
admit ：作"接受"讲时，强调准许或批准。
take ：与receive同意，是receive的日常用法，侧重不带主观意愿地收下或接受。

word_mean: 收到从通信系统中送出的信号、消息或其他形式的数据。

sentence.Network_en: Children at school receive coloured stars for work well done.
sentence.Network_cn: 学校里的孩子表现得好会得到彩色星星。

sentence.Network_en: She went to New York to receive the award in person.
When we are off sick, we only receive half pay.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们请病假的时候只能拿一半薪水。

英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... perceive 知觉；发觉 receive 接受；收到 receipt 收据.
个人简历英文翻译词汇大全_百度文库 ... reach 达到 receive 收到，得到，接受 recognize 认清（职责等）.

业余电台通讯用语 ... CARD 卡片 RECEIVER 接收机 CONFIRM 确认、认为.
the policemen received an order and set out at once ., 警察接到命令立刻出发了.
/rd是什么意思_百度知道 ... 2.readiness date 待命日期，准备装卸日期 3.received 被接受，收到，收讫 7.reduce 缩减，减少.

phrase.cizu_name: be at (或 on) the receiving end

jx.jx_en_mean: be the person to whom a telephone call is made

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French receivre, based on Latin recipere, from re- 'back' + capere 'take'

encyclopedia.content: 及物动词 vt. 1. 收到，接到 I've just received a telegram. 我刚收到一份电报。 2. 得到，受到，遭受 They received the support of the workers. 他们得到工人们的支持。 3. 接待，欢迎；接受，接纳；承认 His speech was well received. 他的演讲很受欢迎。 4. 锛埼尴叩纭⒌缡语級接收 5. 容纳 6. 收买锛堅呶镲級 7. 接球不及物动词 vi. 1. 收到；得到；接收 It is more blessed to give than to receive. 施比受更有福。 2.

entry.def: When you receive something, you get it after someone gives it to you or sends it to you.

example.ex: They will receive their awards at a ceremony in Stockholm...
example.tran: 他们会在斯德哥尔摩举行的仪式上接受颁奖。

example.ex: I received your letter of November 7.
example.tran: 我收到了你11月7日的来信。

entry.def: You can use receive to say that certain kinds of thing happen to someone. For example if they are injured, you can say that they received an injury.

example.ex: He received more of the blame than anyone when the plan failed to work...
example.tran: 计划失败后，他受到了比别人更多的指责。

example.ex: She was suffering from whiplash injuries received in a car crash.

entry.def: When you receive a visitor or a guest, you greet them.

example.ex: The following evening the duchess was again receiving guests...
example.tran: 第二天晚上公爵夫人又在会客。

example.ex: The shop assistant received me indifferently while leaning on a counter.
example.tran: 商店售货员靠在柜台上漫不经心地招呼我。

entry.def: If you say that something is received in a particular way, you mean that people react to it in that way.

example.ex: The resolution had been received with great disappointment within the PLO...
example.tran: 巴解组织内部对决议表现出极大失望。

example.ex: The proposals have been well received by many deputies.
example.tran: 这些提议在许多代表中反响不错。

entry.def: When a radio or television receives signals that are being transmitted, it picks them up and converts them into sound or pictures.

example.ex: The reception was a little faint but clear enough for him to receive the signal.
example.tran: 接收到的信号有点弱，但对他来说已够清晰，可以接收到。

entry.def: If someone receives stolen goods, they buy or are given things that have been stolen.

example.ex: He went to prison for receiving stolen scrap iron...
example.tran: 他因为收购偷来的废铁而入狱。

example.ex: He received the shoes when stolen, and then passed them on to the men who would sell them.
example.tran: 他接收偷盗的鞋子，然后把它们再转给那些销赃者。

entry.tran: 经历（不愉快的事情）；成为受害者
entry.def: If you are on the receiving end or at the receiving end of something unpleasant, you are the person that it happens to.

example.ex: You saw hate in their eyes and you were on the receiving end of that hate...
example.tran: 你在他们的眼睛里看到仇恨，而且你就是他们仇恨的对象。

example.ex: Bullying can indeed be distressing and frightening for those at the receiving end.
example.tran: 受到欺凌的人会真实地感到痛苦和害怕。

means.word_mean: 1. get something; come into possession of;

sentences.sentence: "These aspects of civilization do not find expression or receive an interpretation"
"I got nothing but trouble for my good intentions"

means.word_mean: 4. of mental or physical states or experiences;
5. express willingness to have in one's home or environs;
7. bid welcome to; greet upon arrival
11. receive as a retribution or punishment;
12. partake of the Holy Eucharist sacrament

sentences.sentence: "Her new collection of poems was not well received"

stems_affixes.word_buile: conceive[v.想象;构想;怀孕]+able可以……的→adj.可想象的
receive[[v.接受;收到]]eive变体为cip+ent……的;人或物等→recipient接受的;接受者
con共同+ceit=ceive拿,抓,握住→[自以为]全部抓到→自大
receive[[v.接受;收到]]eive变体为cip+ent……的;人或物等→recipient接受的;接受者
con共同+ceive抓→大家一起抓[思想]→构想

Sentence.sentence: The quality of education to receive.

Indeed, according to surveys, employers have expressed a preference for students who have received a broadly-based education that has taught them to write well, think critically, research creatively, and communicate easily.
Those who have received a well-rounded education
Reinforcement occurs when we receive direct or indirect rewards or punishments for particular gender role behaviors.
The man is uncertain how his art works will be received.
Employees who receive a very favorable evaluation may deserve some type of recognition or even a promotion.

sentences.en: Our TV receives well since we had a new antenna put on.
sentences.cn: 自从安装了新天线以来, 我们的电视接收良好。

sentences.en: I like to receive presents on my birthday.
sentences.cn: 我喜欢在生日那天收到生日礼物。

sentences.en: Lady Jones receives on Monday afternoon.
sentences.cn: 星期一下午琼斯夫人接见来访者。

sentences.en: There we received several weeks of training.
sentences.cn: 在那里我们接受了几星期的训练。

sentences.en: He received severe injuries and nearly lost his life during the Second World War.
sentences.cn: 在第二次世界大战期间他身负重伤险些丧命。

sentences.en: His newly published novel was well received.
sentences.cn: 他新出版的小说受到人们的欢迎。

sentences.en: The local court received her petition for divorce.
sentences.cn: 地方法院受理了她的离婚申请。

jushi.english: Our TV receives well since we had a new antenna put on.
jushi.chinese: 自从安装了新天线以来,我们的电视机接收良好。

jushi.english: Lady Jones receives on Monday afternoon.
jushi.chinese: 星期一下午琼斯夫人接见来访者。

jushi.english: The new law has received the royal assent.
jushi.chinese: 新的法律已得到国王的批准。
